Fahed is trading in used furniture. He is requesting a loan of 2,000 JD to purchase more furniture for trading purposes.

Fahed is looking to have branches for his shop in different locations.

loans.use: to purchase used furniture to sell

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 40 years of age. She is very active and performs her household duties very actively. 
She also does decorative embroidery and prepares beautiful clothes for her clients. She knows about the latest trends in clothing which helps her in fulfilling her clients' requirements.
Her husband sells local food called samosay.  His food is very tasty and he makes reasonable income from his business. 
When Naseem is free, she helps her husband in his business by preparing samosay with potatoes.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her eldest son who also sells samosay. With the loan investment, he will purchase potatoes, spices and other ingredients used in making better quality samosay. 
He has operated his business for many years and Naseem is hopeful about his business success after investing the loan funds.

Note:”In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Naseem.”

loans.use: To buy potatoes, spices and cooking oils for food selling business

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar, holding the Asasah passbook in the photo, has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s animal selling business. With the loan, he will buy young animals such as goats and sheep. He will raise them and sell them for profit.

Kosar is also a working lady. She makes sweaters and sells them in the local market. She has given birth to six children. Only one of them is able to attend school.

Kosar is very confident that her husband will make good use of the loan and successfully improve his business and  that she will be in position to send her younger children to school in the near future.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for sale.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a conservative person. She is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet so the woman in the photo is her daughter, Sarah. Sahar is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of two children.

Seven  years ago, Sahar established her own beauty salon and she worked hard to brand it and increase her customer base. Now Sahar's salon is well known in her area and she is looking to add additional improvements to modernize it. Sahar is requesting a loan of 1,800 JD to purchase tools and products needed for the salon.

loans.use: to purchase tools and products for her salon

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 50 years old, married, and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Sto. Domingo in the province of Isabela. Her main source of income is raising pigs for breeding. She has been in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

Edna is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Edna hopes that someday her hog raising business will improve so that she can better provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 35-year-old divorced woman from Sahab, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Nada is selling cosmetics and perfumes from her home. Nada is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more quantities of perfumes and cosmetics for trading purposes. Nada is looking to improve her family's living conditions and to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Elichka

texts.en:
Elichka lives in Shikahogh village with her husband. The couple has been involved in beekeeping for 10 years now. The main source of income for the family comes from gathering honey and selling it in Kapan and Yerevan cities, where this product is in big demand. 
To get more income from beekeeping, Elichka has some plans to increase the number of beehives. Thus, she has applied for this loan to purchase beehives. Additional income is vital for Elichka to improve her household conditions and live better.

loans.use: to purchase beehives

loans.name: Salah Al Dein

texts.en:
Salah Al Dein is a 35-year-old married man from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a father of four children.

Salah Al Dein is a mechanic who is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to purchase new equipment for his store.

Salah Al Dein is looking to add additional improvements to his store and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and two small children. Narine runs a farm, where she cultivates potatoes and beans and breeds livestock and sheep. Her husband helps her to run the farm. Over the last seven years, through their hard work, the couple has developed the farm and insured a stable source of income for their children. 

Narine has applied for this loan to develop her cattle breeding business. With the requested amount, she plans to purchase livestock. She expects to increase her income by expanding her farm. She dreams of insuring access to higher education for her children in the future. The development of her farm is vital for her to implement her dream.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah is a conservative person who is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. Thus, the man in the photo is her husband.

Fatimah is a 43-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Fatimah is selling wedding gowns and dresses. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JD to purchase wedding gowns for trading purposes.

Fatimah is looking to open a shop for her business since she is currently working from her home with an aspiration of purchasing a house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase wedding gowns for trading purposes

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia, holding the Asasah passbook in the photo, has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy beads, embroidery frames, and clothing in bulk, which will allow her to offer better quality services to her clients and make more profits. She is very skillful and loves her work. Razia's husband works and supports her, while her five children do embroidery at home. She is a very confident lady and has a good number of clients who give her regular orders. She is very confident about the future growth and improvement of her business after investing the loan.

Razia wants to give her eldest daughter, who is 24 years old, in marriage, and she hopes that she will be able to provide a dowry with her increased income.

loans.use: to buy beads and embriodery frames for her embriodery business.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 31-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Samar is a tailor who works from her home and is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase materials needed.

Samar is looking to establish her own workshop with an aspiration of purchasing a house for the family in addition to providing a good amount of money to insure her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as fabrics, thread, etc

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in Yei. She has been running a food stall for five years. She is 40 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are still in school. 

Charity heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Saidnemat

texts.ru: Саиднеъмат женат и на воспитании имеет троих несовершеннолетних детей. Супруга занимается домохозяйством. Саиднеъмат занимается предоставлением транспортных услуг (такси) на собственном автомобиле с 2010-го года. Ежедневно он зарабатывает на жизнь и обеспечивает свои нужды. Саиднеъмат запрашивает займ для ремонта своего автомобиля с целью высококачественного обслуживания клиента. Саиднеъмат надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Saidnemat is married and is raising three underage children. His wife is a homemaker. Saidnemat is providing a taxi service on his own car since 2010. He makes his living daily and provides for his needs. Saidnemat is asking for a loan to repair his car with the goal to provide a high quality service for his clients. Saidnemat is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Mukhabat

texts.ru: Мухабат 49 лет, замужем,  воспитала 4 детей.  В 1995 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Мухабат начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммой в 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Мухабат сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 10,000 сом (KGS) с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях увеличения поголовья скота за счет покупки 2 дойных коров и 6 овец, Мухабат обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Мухабат планирует вложить в проведение ремонта дома, а в дальнейшем - в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Mukhabat is 49 years old, married and has raised four children. While looking for a source of income for her family Mukhabat started her business in 1995 doing animal husbandry with a starting capital of 1,000 som (KGS). Through persistence and hard work Mukhabat was able to grow her business with a monthly income of 10,000 KGS from the sale of milk and dairy products. With the goal to increase the headcount of livestock by buying two milk cows and six sheep Mukhabat has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS. Mukhabat plans to invest the income from the loan to repair her home and in the future into growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 51 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y solidaria. Es conviviente con José  quien es empleado y padre de sus 6 hijos que en su mayoría son independientes. Está habitando cómodamente una casa que es de su propiedad, en compañía de su pareja y su ultima hija, Francis de 10 años de edad a quien quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Isabel es la venta de comida tales como tallarines, pollos fritos, juanes, arroz chaufa y otros, tanto en las mañanas como desayunos y almuerzos, para eso instala su mesa en el frontis de su casa, que cuenta con un techado para la protección de sus clientes, todos los días por las mañanas. 
Ella se inicio hace mas de 1 año,  atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos y amistades, llegando a acabar todo lo que prepara, contando con la ayuda de su nuera quien también tiene un capital que invertió en éste negocio. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta  su actividad ya que le permite distraerse y estar ocupada, además de brindarle el oficio de cocinar que aprendió de su madre, logrando tener una regular clientela que le deja buenas ganancias. Este será el préstamo 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para poder cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a ser puntal con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, desea comprar abarrotes de primera necesidad para empezar con su nuevo negocio buscando precios más bajos para así tener mejores ganancias. También ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de comidas y utensilios como platos, tasas y demás.
texts.en:
Isabel, 51, is a hardworking woman, as well as being happy and supportive.  She lives with José, an employee and the father of her six children, the majority of whom are independent.  She is living comfortably in a house she owns, with her partner and her last daughter, Francis, 10, whom she loves very much.

The work she does is selling food such as spaghetti, fried chicken, "juanes" [similar to tamales, except made with rice and stuffed with fish, chicken, or yucca], "arroz chaufa" [fried rice], and other things, both for breakfast in the morning and for lunches.  For this she sets up her table in the front of her house, with a roof to protect the customers, every day in the morning.

She started more than a year ago, very cordially serving her customers, who are mostly her own neighbors and friends, who finishes everything she prepares.  She has the help of her daughter-in-law who also invested some capital in this business.  She considers her business to be very profitable for the good profits it gives her.

She likes her job because it allows her to amuse herself and be busy.  It also gives her the job of cooking that she learned from her mother, managing to have a regular clientele that gives her good profits.

This will be her third loan with the MFP institution.  She hopes for a small loan to be able to realize her objectives.  On the other hand, she promises to be punctual in making her payments, as with the previous loans.

With the requested amount of 1500 nuevos soles (PEN) she wants to buy groceries to begin with her new business, looking for lower prices to have better profits.  She also wants to buy the necessary ingredients to make food, and utensils such as plates, glasses, and others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, kitchen utensils, and basic household necessities to set up a store.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 25-year-old married woman and mother of one child. Five years ago she got married and moved to her husband's village and started her own business: a mobile phone selling shop.  She used to work in an accessories shop, which she left when she got married.

Hiba is a hard-working woman who can't stop working at all.  In addition to selling mobile phones, Hiba introduces her customers to new accessories, gifts and cosmetics that she is also selling. Hiba wants perfection in her business.  She applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy used mobile phones to sell at special prices.  She hopes to improve and expand her business more and more in the future.

loans.use: buy used mobile phones

loans.name: Khalifeh Group

texts.en:
Nahiya is a 36-year-old married woman, who has operated a clothing shop for 18 months.  She is a hardworking woman, who works hard to support her family in their living. Nahiya is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her merchandise with a special spring-summer collection to be ready for her customers needs.  Nahiya hopes to open another branch in the future. 

Mouna is a 39-year-old teacher, who is preparing herself for her wedding.  She provides good education to her students.  Being a tutor is a hard work to do but she is now used to it.  She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to start an extra business to support her married life.
She hopes to make good living for her family in the future.

Nour is a 17-year-old single tutor, who works to cover her university fees and make her living.  Nour is a hardworking girl who dreams of finishing her studies an starting her own career  In order to do so, Nour has to pay fees to the university, that cover most of the requested projects.  She applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to cover her university fees.  She hopes that her future will be exactly as she dreams, starting her own successful business in Media, which is her major at the university. 

Nour is a 19-year-old single tutor, she is studying business at the university, and is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for her university fees. She hopes to be a banker, since she loves all financial work and communication with people.  She hopes that her students will be important people in the future.

loans.use: To pay for their university fees and improve their businesses

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 30-year-old married woman and mother of three children.  She started her own business three years ago to support her family and help her husband meet their needs.

Fatima sells accessories, perfumes, cosmetics and clothes.  Now she is intending to expand her business and add a toys sector in addition to selling all bridal needs from lingerie to many other requested things, through a youth loan she applied for from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.

Fatima is well-known in the region and works hard to reply to most of her customer's needs all at the same time.  Fatima intends to expand her business more and more in the future to attract more customers.

loans.use: buy toys and bridal accessories

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 29-year-old married man and the father of two children.

Maher has worked in the international transportation business since 2002 on his own, with ten years of experience in this field. He owns a six-wheel truck and really enjoys his work because he discovers different countries on his way. Maher is a hard worker and he works his best to please his family.

Maher has been an Al Majmoua Kiva partner borrower for two cycles. His previous loan was supposed to be invested in his business through registering his newly bought truck, which he works on when he is in Lebanon and which he might rent to someone else to work on while he is away. But he was forced to use the loan for his wife's hospital expenses when she had to bring her beautiful baby to life.

He is so happy with his small family, but now it's time for business improvement. Maher is requesting a Youth Loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to register the truck and work officially on it, since he is not working on it as it should be.

loans.use: to register his truck.

loans.name: Al Sadaka Group

texts.en:
Samira is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. In 2009, she started selling Brazilian gold and beauty cosmetics. Samira works from her house to manage both her business and family issues. Her husband supported her a lot at the beginning and now she is capable enough to manage her business as much as she can.

Samira is a hardworking woman. She applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her products with a new cosmetics collection necessary for the spring/summer season.

Samira hopes to expand her business more and more in the future and stay capable of supporting her family as much as she can.

Fawziya is a 62-year-old divorced woman with no children. She worked hard to start her own business so that she wouldn't need anyone's help. Fifteen years ago, Fawziya started selling clothes with the help of her sister's children, who gave her the capital requested to start a business of her own. It was a hard step to take, but she had to make her own career.

With the requested loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, Fawziya will start selling Brazilian gold and beauty cosmetics in addition to clothes, attracting enough customers. She hopes she can go to France during the sales season to buy special clothes that fit her customers’ needs and satisfy their desires.

Fatima is a 33-year-old married woman and mother of three children. In 2007, she started her own business selling Brazilian gold and beauty cosmetics. Her husband helped her a lot at the beginning. He led her to most of the dealers and she is dealing with them these days. Fatima is a courageous woman who works hard to reach her goals. Fatima is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her products. She found a shop which she intends to rent and will make the necessary changes in it to open it very soon. Fatima hopes to succeed more and more in her business in the future.

loans.use: to increase their products with new collections in order to increase their income.

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr: Madame Aida est âgée  de 48 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal et s’active dans le commerce de tissus. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par nécessité. Elle  est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs. Ce financement lui permettra d’honorer ses engagements vis-à-vis de ses fournisseurs. Grâce à son crédit  elle pourra développer son activité de commerce, accroitre ses bénéfices et assurer l’amélioration de son niveau de vie.
texts.en: Aida is 48 years old.  She lives in Senegal and is actively involved in the sale of fabrics.  She chose this activity out of necessity.  She is a member of one of the UIMCEC branches and is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs.  This loan will allow her to fulfill her commitments towards her suppliers. Thanks to this loan, she will also be able to develop her retail business, increase her profits and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to fulfill her commitments towards her suppliers.

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru: Уулкан  51 год, замужем,  воспитала 2 детей. Уулкан работает медсестрой в местной больнице. В 2005 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Уулкан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве с покупки 5 коз. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Уулкан сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 10,000 сом (KGS) с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития совего бизнеса, Уулкан обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Уулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Uulkan is 51 years old, married, and has raised two children.  She works as a nurse at a local hospital.  In 2005, in search of a source of income for her family, she started her own animal husbandry business, starting with the purchase of 5 goats.  Through persistence and hard work, she was able to develop her business and now earns a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk and dairy products.  In order to further develop her business, Uulkan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS).  She plans to invest the profits from this loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina generates income by engaging in a hog-raising business. She and her husband live happily in a village, also planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. They aim to raise their status of living so they can educate their two children and give them a bright future. 

Marina hopes to improve and strengthen her hog-raising business and make it a viable source of income. Because she has insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 34,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for hog-raising. She believes that her loan will enable her to make improvements in her business and hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for hog-raising.

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Yei. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 years old and married with three children; two of them are still in school. 

Jane heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish to sell. She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Siama

texts.en:
Siama lives in Buluki. She sells bread, and has been in business for three years. She is 38 years old and married with five children; all of them are still in school. 

Siama heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase bread to sell. She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Yei. She sells fish, and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old and married with four children; three of them are still in school. 

Joyce heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 600 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish to sell. She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Bannawag

texts.en:
Bannawag was not given the chance to finish his college level of education. Instead, he chose to build a hog-raising business for breeding and fattening five years ago. His goal in life is to give quality living to his family. He works hard and manages his business well to attain his goals.

Bannawag is 48 years of age, married and has two children that he is sending to school. Bannawag has plenty of hogs to feed. Sometimes he has difficulties in providing his hogs feed, because he is also providing his children allowances while they are in school. Bannawag is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy feed for his hogs. He believes the loan will be a big help for him to lessen his difficulties in maintaining the hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is a local rice cultivator from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is a responsible mother of three school-aged children and one married child. The three children have always helped on her farm, over the years, in their free time. Neang enjoys performing her daily tasks in the rice field.

Neang is looking for a loan from HKL to purchase a cow to keep working on her farm. With the balance, she will hire people to dig a well in her yard. Neang hopes to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to work on her farm.

loans.name: Moeurng

texts.en:
Moeurng is in her fifties and is a married woman who lives in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She works as a farmer as do many other villagers. Specifically, she grows rice crops. For additional income, Moeurng sells fresh fish and fermented fish paste in a neighbourhood market.  She can earn approximately USD 2.50 each day. She has four children, all of whom work in Phnom Penh city.

With the requested amount of HKR 1,200,000 Moeurng wants to add to her cash on hand to purchase fresh fish in bulk, from which fermented fish paste is made. She hopes to make a good income through the investment.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish in bulk.

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Hout, aged 60, is a loving father who has been cultivating rice for ages in Kompong Speu province. He is married and lives with his wife, four single children and two grandchildren. 

He now would like a loan from HKL to pay for house repairs. This is his first loan with our firm and he is confident he will repay his loan as scheduled punctually.

loans.use: to pay for house repairs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal and has been in this business for three years. She is 38 years old, married and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Victoria heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested 3000 Sudanese pounds to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal and has been in this business for three years. She is 35 years old, married and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Jane heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested 1000 Sudanese pounds to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian lives in Buluk. She has been running a food stall for three years. She is 38 years old, married and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Lillian heard about BRAC, South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested 800 Sudanese pounds to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan she will buy beads and embroidery thread of better quality and larger quantity. This will allow her to make more profit from her business.
Her husband works as a daily wage laborer. His income is not guaranteed because sometimes he doesn’t get any work.
Rehana is the mother of 4 sons. Two of them work while the others remain at home. Due to financial constraints, she couldn’t provide them with an education.
She is very confident that the loan will help her to improve her business and will make positive changes for her family’s financial future.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Hin, 31, is married and resides with his wife in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh city. He works as a farmer in the rainy season and also in the construction field for extra income, earning USD 5.00 per day. He has 3 single children who are still students and depend on his support.

Hin would like a loan of USD 1,100 which will be his third loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner. He wants to purchase a couple of cows to expand his farming business. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of cows to expand his farming business.

loans.name: Janety

texts.en:
Janety lives in Buluk. She has been running a food stall for three years. She is 40 years old, married and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Janety heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested 1000 Sudanese pounds to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Kevina

texts.en: Kevina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children. Three of her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a restaurant from home. She has been in business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas, rice, cooking oil, and beef. Her major business challenges are defaulters and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to build a permanent house for her restaurant and also to own a fully-stocked restaurant. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, rice, cooking oil, and beef

loans.name: Mega

texts.en: Mega lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (a brother). She has aretail shop at the market. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 900,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. She generates additional income through selling charcoal and firewood. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and to own a delivery van to ease in transportation of commodities. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt  and boxes of soap

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Maria has a restaurant business.  She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.   Maria sells her products at the market, by means of retail.  Maria has requested  for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, beef, sausages and liver. The main business challenges for Maria include thieves and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully-stocked restaurant and to employ two girls to assist in the work. Maria lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication and school fees

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, beef sausages and liver

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and all her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She is a tailor at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials and accessories. Her major business challenges are increasing prices of clothing materials and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand into a wholesale business. She lives in her own house but  the family has no access to electricity and  piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and accessories

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children. All of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her brother’s transport business. With the loan he will buy a new autorickshaw body which will help him to retain his business asset and will enable him to offer better transport services.
Nasreen is a housewife, stays at home and does her household responsibilities.
She has given birth to 6 children. Three of them work while staying at home.
She is hopeful that her brother’s business will be improved after investing the loan and that his family’s financial life will get better.
Note:”In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Nasreen.”

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw body

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Kung is 50 years old and has only finished elementary education. She has been blessed with seven children. She aims to provide a good education for them so that they may find better employment than her: she is just involved in rice farming. She has been in this business with her spouse for almost 7 years in Prey Chor district. She prepares and cultivates the land twice a year.

Kung is now asking for a loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for farming in the coming season. She has insufficient funds so she hopes this loan will be granted to help her improve her crops and also their lives. Someday she aims to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Julius has operated in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last three years. He is 27 years old, married to Rahab and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to to service his motorbike.

In the future, Julius hopes to buy a pickup truck, which he will be using to transport goods to and from the market.

loans.use: to service his motorbike.

loans.name: Kinuthia

texts.en:
Kinuthia, aged 28, is married to Leah and they are blessed with one child. He sells electronics and has been doing this business for five years. His monthly income from the business is KES 13,400.

This is Kinuthia's second loan form KADET LTD, and he has successfully repaid the previous loan. He will use the funds to buy more tools for electronic repair. Kinuthia hopes to open a wholesale business for electronics in the future.

loans.use: to buy tools for electronic repairs.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 28 years old man from Homabay town and is married to Caroline. They have two children, ages one and two years old.

Christopher operates a cafeteria business, a business he has been doing for the last four years.  He earns a monthly income of KES 4,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy foodstuffs such as kale, tomatoes, baking flour, wheat flour, and maize flour for the cafeteria. His profits will be used to repay the loan.

His dream is to excel in his business and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like kale, tomatoes, baking flour, wheat flour, and maize flour.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal and has been in this business for three years. She is 48 years old, married and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Alice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested 1000 Sudanese pounds to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 27-year-old single man who owns a house that has electricity and running water.  His greatest monthly expense is electricity bills.

For the past three years, he has operated a business of selling cereals to his neighbors and passersby.  George also earns additional income by operating a hardware shop.  He dreams of expanding to a wholesale cereals shop in the future.

With the loan of 20,000 KES he wants to purchase sacks of maize, rice and beans to sell.  He decided to join Yehu in order to access credit to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Rany's Group

texts.en:
Rany is a villager living in one of the remote areas in the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. 
As a 43-year-old mother, she needs to be responsible for 4 dependent children: another one is already independent. One of her four children is still in school. She has been striving to support her family by growing rice and planting sesame for 20 years on her 2-hectare plot of farmland. She earns about US$5 per day.

Even though this is her first loan with VisionFund, she still acts confidently as the leader of a two member group loan. She is requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to buy sesame seed. She believes that she will grow healthy sesame in a timely fashion so that she can earn more income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy sesame seed

loans.name: Probo

texts.en:
Probo is a rice farmer in the Philippines. To gain extra profit, Probo engages in hog raising, primarily hogs for fattening. He has been in this type of business for four years. Probo wants to maintain the business as an additional source of income for his family.
Probo is 33 years old, married and blessed with two children. His wife is a teacher. She is his only partner in running his business. His wife's salary covers their daily expenditure like food and electricity. Sometimes it also provides his hogs with feed.
Probo doesn’t want to only rely on his wife's earnings. He wants to help his wife even if only in a simple way. For this reason, Probo decided to ask for a loan of P25,000 to buy feed for his hogs. It will be a big help for him, and also his wife.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines was born in the southern city of Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. She is a single mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She is pursuing a degree in sociology, and she intends to continue with her studies. She lives in her own house with her family, and supports a niece that lives with her.

She has worked for the state government for three yearsas an administrative assistant, and earns a salary of $32,000MTN per month, which she uses to fund household expenses and contribute to her savings account in BIM bank. She has already had one loan with this same bank, which she paid back without difficulty. Now, she takes out loans with Hluvuku, which she discovered through a friend who is also a Hluvuku client. This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000MT, with which she intends to continue work on her home and buy durable goods for her home (a bed, a bureau, and install a closet)to make the residence more comfortable for her family.

In the future, Ines intends to take out more loans with Hluvuku to complete the work on her home.

loans.use: To buy a bed, a storage chest, and a bureau for her home.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 28 years old. She lives in Yerevan with her husband and two children. For seven years now, Julieta has been trading women's jeans in the city market. Due to her personal approach to clients and the good service she provides, Julieta has attracted a large number of loyal clients. 

Julieta would like to increase the variety of jeans for the coming spring/summer season as well as supply shirts for her clients. Thus Julieta has applied for this loan to purchase women's jeans and shirts. 

This loan will help Julieta to increase her sales and receive additional income from trading. Julieta's family lives in a flat for rent, which needs to be repaired. Development of the business will allow the young family to purchase a new house in the future and live with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for women's jeans and shirts.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal and has been in this business for five years. She is 40 years old and married with five children, all of whom are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan with BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia lives in Buluk. She sells shoes and has been in this business for two years. She is 25 years old and married with no children.

Julia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan with BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase shoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for sale.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa lives in Buluk. She sells clothes and has been in this business for three years. She is 30 years old and married with five children, four of whom are still in school. 

Salwa heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 SDG in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal and has been in this business for three years. She is 30 years old and married with five children, two of whom are still in school 

Kamala heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan with BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Thoraya

texts.en:
Thoraya is a 35-year-old woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan.

Thoraya sells perfumes and clothes and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase new quantities for business purposes.

Thoraya is looking to improve her family's living conditions and purchase a car for the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and perfumes for business purposes

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni is 33 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom attend school.  She lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, which she has been doing for three years. 

Poni is requesting her third loan from BRAC for 2,500 SDG, which she will use to purchase charcoal.  She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 53-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Faten sells clothes. She works from her home and is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase new quantities for business purposes.

Faten is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a businesswoman who is a farmer. She has run her farm for seven years and she employs three people. Regina describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business.

Regina is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase a dairy cow. In the future, she hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jehan

texts.en:
Jehan is a 36-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Jehan is looking to improve her family's living conditions and thus is requesting a loan of 700 JD to do maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela is 49 years old. She lives in Artashar village with her 18-year-old son and 25-year-old daughter. Anzhela runs a farm where she breeds cattle. Her children are also involved in the farm's daily activities and always help their mother. Anzhela's farm has a barn and the necessary conditions for cattle breeding.

Anzhela is requesting a loan to purchase two calves. She also plans to use her loan to purchase grass to feed the cattle. Anzhela hopes to get additional income from increasing her herd and this is vital for insuring a brighter future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and cattle feed

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 39 years old and married with five children, four of whom are still in school. She lives in Buluk where she has sold clothes for the past five years. Jane heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.

Jane is requesting 1,500 SDG to purchase clothes. This is her third loan from BRAC. Jane will use the extra income from her loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a conservative person, so she asked her mother-in-law to take her place in the photo.

Amani, 29 years old and a married lady, has two sons and a daughter. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has been selling clothes at home for almost a year. Her target audience was at first her neighbors, friends and relatives, but now she wants to extent to reach their friends, too, so she decided to add selling electronics so she could have more variety in the products she sells. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add the sale of electronics to selling clothing

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan, and a mother of four children. She sells clothes and she works from her home.

Yasmeen is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more clothes for business purposes. She is looking to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 49-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Nawal is a tailor who works from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase materials needed such as fabrics and thread, etc.

Nawal is looking to establish her own shop with an aspiration of purchasing a home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed (fabrics, thread, etc.)

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 24 years old. For the past two years, she has sold second-hand clothes to earn a living. Beatrice describes her business environment as good because she faces limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business.

Beatrice is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy second-hand clothes to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a conservative person and she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet, thus the woman in the photo is her mother-in-law.

Layla is a 32-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a mother of three children. She has a home-based micro project selling clothes and blankets so she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more clothes and blankets for business purposes.

Layla is looking to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and blankets for business purposes

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 44 years old. She lives in the Davit Bek village with her husband and three sons. The main income for the family comes from agriculture and they breed cattle and cultivate the land. It has been hard for Anush to make ends meet with her current income and she couldn't save enough money to start agriculture projects.

Anush is requesting a loan to purchase seeds to cultivate her land and to purchase cattle to increase her herd. She believes her loan will make the farm more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and seeds

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en:
Sabha is a 51-year-old illiterate married woman. She has seven sons and daughters; some of them have got married, and her husband has already retired from his job.

To help her husband, Sabha used to bake a special type of bread called "Shrak" and sell it to neighbors, or even to a small food market. Now that her husband has retired, they decided to expand her business and start making yogurt and cheese. 

So Sabha has applied for this loan to renew the registration of their van so they can use it for distribution and buy a large quantity of milk in order to make cheese and yogurt.

loans.use: to renew the registration of the van they use for distribution and buy a large quantity of milk

loans.name: Mekhak

texts.en:
Mekhak is a 38-year-old entrepreneur. He lives in Yerevan with his wife and two school-age children. For almost three years, Mekhak has been running a shop where he trades food and different household goods. Due to his personal qualities, he has been able to sustain and grow his business. 

Mekhak is requesting a loan to continue developing his business and purchase food for his shop. His loan will help Mekhak increase his income, which is vital for him to cover his family's daily costs and provide for his daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cleaning products to increase her revenue.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou habite au Sénégal et a l’âge de 49 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur  du  commerce et gère un restaurant dans le quartier ou elle vit. Elle a choisi son activité par nécessité. Elle est sociétaire du guichet de l’U-IMCEc de sa zone  d’habitation depuis 2010. Elle  a déjà remboursé 2 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour réfectionner son restaurant dans le but de rendre plus accueillant le local ou elle accueille ses clients. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices   pourront l’aider a s’assurer un niveau de vie meilleur.
texts.en:
Aissatou is 49 years old and live in Senegal. She is involved in the business sector and runs a restaurant in the neighborhood where she lives. She chose this line of work out of necessity.

She has been a member of the branch of U-IMCEC in her area since 2010. She has already paid back two previous loans.

She is seeking a loan of 150,000 frs to make repairs to her restaurant in order to make the area where she welcomes her customers more inviting. An increase in her profits will help her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to make repairs to her restaurant

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a  36-year-old housewife. She has six children. Her husband works as a bus driver for a university. 

Iman has recently started a small retail business to help in supporting their family. Her business is basically selling clothes, home products, and some electronics out of her home. Currently, her customers are limited to her neighbors, relatives and friends. She hopes with the time the circle will become bigger and she can therefore expand her business and open a store selling home products and electronics. 

Iman has applied for this loan to increase the quantity and type of products she has in her inventory.

loans.use: to expand the quantity and type of products she has in her inventory

loans.name: Adeelah

texts.en:
Adeelah is a 44-year-old housewife who has two daughters and one son.

Living in the same area for more than 10 years and also her sociable personality have given her the push to start a home business selling olive oil tanks and home-made pickles. Now that the neighbors and their friends buy from her and even order a specific type of pickles, her business has been growing more and more.

Now Adeelah has applied for this loan to increase her working capital so she can start dealing with the olive pressers and factories to get more fresh olive oil at a lower price.

loans.use: to increase her working capital so she can start dealing with the olive processors and factories

loans.name: Nojood

texts.en:
Nojood is a 25-year-old married lady. She has three children.
 
Nojood wanted to participate in the family income, so she started a retail business selling clothes from home.
 
Now Nojood has applied for this loan to buy a spring collection of clothes.

loans.use: to buy a spring collection of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam is a 31-year-old single lady. 

Tamam is a hard-working farmer and recently she decided to start a small home business beside the work she already does to increase her income, so she started buying and selling blankets during this winter. For the next seasons she wants to start selling suitable bed covers beside blankets, and for that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy bed covers as well as blankets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more spring clothes and straw to increase her revenue.

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en:
Ghadeer is a conservative person. She has asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Ghadeer, 25 years old, is a married lady with four children. Her husband, Yousef, owns a repairing store where he repairs electronics like heaters, refrigerators, etc., and sells electronics parts too. 

Ghadeer wants to support her husband in his business so they can improve their living conditions, so she has applied for this loan to buy more electronics parts so they can depend on selling the parts more than on the maintenance section.

loans.use: to buy more electronics parts

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is 20 years old and a single lady. She lives with her family in a rented house.

Amneh has always been interested in make-up and beauty, so she even took training courses to learn how to do make-up, manicure, pedicure, and hair styles. Now Amneh has bought the basic tools for starting a beauty salon business and has based it currently at her home. 

She has applied for a loan to buy more equipment for establishing her beauty salon so she can separate it in the future from her home after increasing her profitability.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for establishing her beauty salon

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia, 45 years old and a married woman, is a mother of two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a bus driver.

Nadia recently started selling used clothes at home to help her husband and her family improve their living conditions. Now Nadia is working on making a special room at her house for selling more clothes where she will have a section for used clothes and another for new ones. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To add a new section for selling new clothes as well as used ones.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is 57-year-old man who is married and has two children. 

He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. During these years Asif gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, like pilau and dolma, are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan, and families also make fresh punch. He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Asif wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Aork

texts.en:
Aork is 51 years old and a married woman who resides in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She has three married children and three single children, who currently are living with her. She has been a widow for a few years. 

Aork tries to work hard to support her family. She is involved in agriculture business cultivating rice in the rainy season. For additional income, Aork acts as a seamstress at home. She repairs clothes, coats, robes and outerwear. In parallel, two of her daughters are working in the same field as her. They work for a clothes shop as seamstresses. 

Aork would like to have a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase a used motorcycle for her daughters to commute to their workplace. In the future as her business goal, Aork wants to have as many customers as possible, so she’ll buy another sewing machine with different functions to satisfy them.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is a 26-year-old married lady who has three sons and a daughter. Her husband works in a training club as a karate trainer.

To help her husband in supporting the family, Ilham started a small home-based business selling blankets. 

Now she has applied for a loan to add new products for sale, such as clothes or home products, to increase the business revenue.

loans.use: to add new products for sale such as clothes or home products.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman, 26 years old and a married lady has two sons. She has recently started to make embroidered sheets and covers. She uses thread and different shapes of beads.

Now Iman is working on expanding and making more profit so she can open her own accessorized items shop. She has applied for this loan to buy more fabric, thread and beads.

loans.use: to buy more fabric, thread and beads

loans.name: Aharon

texts.en:
Aharon is 41 years old and he lives with his wife and two children. About two years ago, this enthusiastic person decided to start a retail fish business. Now, Aharon runs a little shop where trades in different fish products. 

Aharon is requesting a loan to purchase live and frozen fish and to purchase a freezer. He has had a lack of financial investment in his business. His loan will help Aharon increase sales and develop his business to make it more profitable. With his additional income, he will improve his living conditions to insure a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fish and a freezer

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is a conservative woman, so she asked her son Yousef to take her place in the photo.

Yusra is a 52-year-old married woman. She has five sons who work as calligraphers in their own family shop. They are supporting the family since their father has an illness that does not allow him to work.

Yusra wants to support her sons, so she has applied for this loan to enhance the internal decoration of the shop and buy more tools needed for calligraphic work.

loans.use: to buy more tools needed for calligraphic work.

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en:
Rafiqa is 47 years old and is a single woman who lives with her parents. She sells different home products such as buckets, basins, baskets, but her main business is working as a florist. Rafiqa has ten years of experience raising flowers and she knows every detail for any sort of flower. Her father helps her to raise flowers and to look after them. The products that she sells are in very high demand, and people in her village know about her experience and always come to her for advice. Rafiqa's monthly income is 300 AZN.

Rafiqa is requesting a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase more merchandise, seeds, fertilizer, and flower pots. This will be her second loan and she has good client history with AqroInvest CU.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, seeds, fertilizer, and flower pots

loans.name: Fatou Kane

texts.fr: Madame Fatou Kane habite dans l’une des communautés villageoises du Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce et la vente de tissus, ustensiles de cuisine et accessoires de femme. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par amour. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité depuis 2006. Elle a déjà remboursé  un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour honorer ses engagements vis-à-vis de ses fournisseurs  pour des  tissus et ustensiles qui lui auraient été livrés.  Ce financement lui permettra de développer son activité pour  mieux se prendre en charge et aussi soutenir son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne du foyer.
texts.en:
Fatou Kane lives in a village community in Senegal. She is in the business of selling fabrics, kitchen utensils, and accessories for women. It's a line of work that she chose out of love.

She has been a member of the branch of the U-IMCEC in her village since 2006. She has already paid back one previous loan.

She is seeking a loan of 200,000 frs to fulfill her obligations to her suppliers for fabrics and utensils that were delivered to her. This loan will allow her to expand her business in order to better support herself and help her husband in covering the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the delivery of items that she offers for sale

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is 49 years old and a divorced woman. To be able to support herself after the divorce, Dalal began to concentrate on her business that she started eight years ago, selling whatever she had got, children's clothes or even home products. 

Dalal is now looking to enhance her little business, whether by the way she promotes her products or by adding new collections to be able to satisfy most people's taste. To be able to do so, Dalal has applied for this loan so she can now open her own clothes shop.

loans.use: to get more clothes to sell

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Fish selling is the main business for Roeun, 39, a resident of the Pouk district in Siem Reap province. She gets fresh fish from local fishermen living in the region and then she takes them to a marketplace of the province. However, she also occasionally goes through the commune to sell her fish as well. From this business, she typically earns around USD 4 per day. She has quite a big family, with ten children.

For her first loan from HKL, Roeun would like to purchase a motorcycle for the entire family’s use. And with the remaining funds, she will buy fishing materials for her husband and sons to fish in the nearby river. She hopes she’ll be able to increase her income and provide her children a good living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle and fishing materials.

loans.name: Prosperito

texts.en:
Prosperito is a business-minded man who dreams of growing his business. He is in the business of selling shoes and slippers in the market. His ability to handle his business and customers is helping his family to set up their living situation. But insufficient capital is a big problem in operating such businesses and Prosperito also experiences it. 

For this matter, Prosperito is asking for a loan of P20,000 from ASKI as additional working capital for his business. It will be used to purchase footwear such as slippers and shoes. He hopes that his loan will provide him greater profit in order to enjoy financial stability. He hopes to be able to give his family a better quality of life and greater possibilities for progress.

loans.use: to purchase footwear such as slippers and shoes

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 53 years old and is married. She was an Overseas Filipino Worker for three years.

Vilma has run a hog-raising business for 30 years. Her duration in the business has served to make her an expert who manages the business well. 

With her experience in life, Vilma wants to prove that there is no harm in trying. She also wants to prove that even a woman can run a hog-raising business. 

Vilma admits that she has not enough capital to maintain the business. Now, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed for her hogs. The loan will help her to maintain the business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Altynchach

texts.ru: Алтынчач  56 лет, вдова,  воспитала 4 детей. В 1991 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Алтынчач начала свой бизнес в животноводстве с начальной суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Алтынчач сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 7,000 сом (KGS) с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Также, Алтынчач возделывает 2 га земли, где сеет эспарцет и пшеницу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алтынчач обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)на покупку бычков на откорм и перепродажу.  Доходы от кредита Алтынчач планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Altynchach is fifty-six years old, widowed and has four children. In 1991, searching for a new source of income for her family, Altynchach started her business in animal breeding with a starting capital of 10,000 soms. Thanks to her dedication and hard work, Altynchach was able to expand her business to a monthly income of 7,000 soms from milk and meat product sales. Additionally, she grows cock's head and wheat on a plot of land. 
Seeking to expand her business even further, Altynchach approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for a loan of 100,000 soms in order to purchase bulls and cattle feed aimed at fattening and reselling the livestock. 
Altynchach plans to invest profits from the loan into her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut, age 33, is operating a pig raising business besides rice husbandry. She is from Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is a responsible mother of three school-aged children who depend on her income. Her spouse helps her earn income through selling firewood from a trailer hauled by his buffaloes.

She is now taking out a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase timbers to start reconstructing her present house. Her business goal is to expand her farming business, secure her family above the poverty line, and provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to start reconstructing her present house.

loans.name: Vath's Group

texts.en:
Vath, 49, is the breadwinner of her household. She has six children in total, five of whom still count on her as two are still in school while the rest are working for others with a minimal income. 

To earn a living, Vath has been farming on  two hectares of farmland for approximately 15 years. Vath has never been with VisionFund before. Now, she has formed a group loan with another member in order to request a new loan; her requested loan is KHR 1,000,000 while the other member is applying for KHR 1,200,000. As the group leader, Vath will use her loan to buy seed and fertilizer for dry season rice farming. She hopes to grow the rice healthfully and earn more income than before.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for dry season rice farming

loans.name: Narin's Group

texts.en:
Narin is a 49-year-old mother of a big family consisting of six children. Out of her six children, she has responsibility for three children who work for others for pay. To ensure the family's subsistence, she has been farming for six years as her main source of income. Additionally, she also runs a small food stall selling Chinese noodles. 

Narin joined VisionFund in 2009 and she consecutively took one loan after another as each loan was repaid. The past two loans have helped her to improve her living conditions and enabled her to have a high crop yield. She has formed a new loan group with another member who is a newly joined client. 

Narin is applying for the loan of KHR 1,400,000 with VisionFund while her co-member is requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000. As the group leader, Narin will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and hire laborers for plowing her farmland in order to grow the dry season rice in a timely manner. Her hope is to keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers for plowing her farmland

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old and has a business position in the market. She sells clothes, gift items and textiles. She started this business 10 years ago. This is a great help in sending her children to school. Her business is somewhat tiring but she is patiently working for the improvement of their living situation. She enjoys her work at the same time because she really likes to greet and chat with her loyal customers.

She wants to provide her target market with a greater variety of products so Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 20,000 pesos to buy clothes such as shirts, skirts, pants and glassware as additional products to offer. She hopes that through her loan and experience from her day-to-day work, she can earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as shirts, skirts, pants and glassware

loans.name: Satum

texts.en:
As a 39-year-old mother, Satom has the responsibility for four children who are still in school. She has been growing rice and raising pigs for sale for 15 years to support the entire family. 

Satum joined VisionFund and received her first loan in 2010. After the first loan was repaid, she took out her second loan shortly and she successfully repaid the entire loan. The loans have helped to earn more income and keep her children in school. Now she can earn about US$7 per day. 

Satum is requesting a new loan of US$1,200 to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland and she will use some proportion of her loan to expand her pig-raising business buying pig feed and more piglets. She hopes to raise her pigs healthfully for sale and earn more income so that she can have household goods and support her children.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland and pig feed plus piglets for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Visal

texts.en:
Visal is a villager in a rural area in Sa Ang district, Cambodia. As a 41-year-old mother, she still has to support three out of her four children. For the sake of her household, she grows corn for sale as the primary source of income. To better feed her family, she also runs a small grocery stall selling canned food, cooking ingredients, etc. She has been with those businesses for 30 years.

Visal has been with VisionFund for  four loan cycles already. She took each loan consecutively after the prior loan was repaid. The loans have helped her to maintain her household and keep her children in school. With the satisfying results, she is requesting a new fifth loan in the amount of US$ 800 in order to buy corn seed for planting and buy a cow for plowing her cornfield. She has a high expectation that she will grow corn in a timely manner for sale in a high price and she will have additional grocery items for sale in order to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy corn seed for planting and buy cow to plow her cornfield

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda, 56, has a carinderia (eatery) in the market. She offers pancit and mikki (noodles), candies, and soft drinks. She's happy to know that she'll have loyal customers who appreciate her cooked food and snacks. 

She wants to offer new recipes and delicious desserts to her customers, so she is asking for financial support from ASKI in the amount of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy ingredients in cooking her new recipes, like macaroni and adobo. She'll feel sure of making progress through her loan with her hard work. Through this, she will be able to improve her business as well as their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking her new recipes like macaroni and adobo

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan investment, he will buy grocery stock such as spices, cooking oil, snacks, etc. in bulk quantity to be able to fulfill the clients' requirements and increase his sales and profits.

Jamila is a housewife, remaining at home and performing her household duties. She has given birth to three daughters and two sons. Her sons work while her daughters are continuing their education.

Jamila is very confident that her husband will be able to compete better against other grocery store owners in the market by putting out a larger grocery stock at his shop and this will help her family to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy spices, snacks, etc. for grocery store business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 26 years old and he sells motor vehicle spare parts to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as busy because many customers visit him regularly. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Peter has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy motor vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal and has been in business for 5 years. She is 41 years old, married, and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal and has been in business for 4 years. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Christine heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Pich's Group

texts.en:
Pich is 46 years old and has 7 children living in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. Out of her 7 children, she needs to be responsible for 4 children. Her residential area is the place in which rice farming is one of the common businesses among the villagers, as well as for Pich's family. She and her husband have been farming for 20 years for the sake of her family. To earn more income, she also works for others for pay. 

From the first loan with VisionFund in 2007 which was successfully repaid, her family's condition has gradually improved as the loan has helped her to generate more income from the high crop yield that she produced on time. Therefore, she is now leading a group loan consisting of 3 other members. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy seed and fertilizer for her dry season rice. She hopes to produce more crop yield and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her dry season rice

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en:
Lilias lives in Yei. She sells fish, and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Lilias heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Sonunbubu

texts.ru:
Сонунбубу 62 года, воспитала 8 детей. С 2009 года Сонунбубу занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). В настоящее время в хозяйстве Сонунбубу имеется   3 дойные коровы, а также 1,60 га земли, где она выращивает ячмень и сено.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сонунбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Сонунбубу планирует вложить в покупку кошары.
texts.en:
Sonunbubu is sixty-two years years old, the mother of eight children. In 2009, with a starting capital of 20,000 soms, she began a business in animal husbandry. Today, Sonunbubu's business consists of three milking cows and 1.6 hectares of land where she grows barley and hay. 
Hoping to expand her business, Sonunbubu approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" requesting a loan of 50,000 soms for the purchase of young livestock. 
She plans to invest profits from the loan into building an enclosure for her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia lives in Yei, South Sudan.  She sells food at a food stall and has been in this business for four years.  Cicilia is a 44- year-old, married woman with five children, three of whom are still in school. 

Cicilia heard about Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds to purchase maize and cassava.  Cicilia will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase maize and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en:
A 48-year-old mother of three dependent children who are still students, Leang is one of the residents in the rural village of the Tbaung Khmum District, Cambodia.
