Por ello comenzó a dedicar todas sus fuerzas en la tienda que instalo en su misma casa y de donde vende productos de primera necesidad, también refrescos y gaseosas y para la mayor comodidad de sus clientes, puso una mesa con sillas para que sus clientes puedan consumir gaseosas con mayor comodidad. Se siente feliz, pues sus hijos la ayudan en la atención y también aprenden cada día del trato adecuado a los clientes, su negocio está mejorando poco a poco y se dio cuenta que es necesario implementarla y no descansará  hasta ver su tienda mejor equipada y en el futuro también vendiendo comida. “todo poco a poco, lo importante son las ganas de progresar”, menciona. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “cristo rey” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias.
Sofía de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero en la compra de más mercadería en productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Sofía is from Chupaca. She is a widow, and currently lives with her two children in her own house that she inherited from her parents. She began her grocery store business two years ago. 

She previously had a restaurant in the central area of the city, which she closed because it wasn't generating profits. For this reason she began to devote all her energies to the store she set up in her own home, where she sells basic household products, as well as soft drinks. She put in a table with chairs so that her customers can have their soft drinks in greater comfort. 

She is happy, as her children help her run the store, and also learn each day how to serve customers properly. Her business is gradually improving, and she realized that it is necessary to run it properly.  She will not rest until she sees her store better equipped, and in the future also selling meals. "Everything little by little--the important thing is the desire to move forward," she comments. 

She belongs to the "Cristo Rey” communal bank, and this is her second loan with MFP, where she feels empowered, as she is getting help to make progress with her business. This is why she promises to make her installment payments on time. She also likes working in her group, as they are responsible and supportive people.

When she receives her loan, Sofía will use the money to buy more merchandise: basic household necessities for her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy basic household necessities to stock her store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei.  She sells fish and has been in business for two years.  She is 30 years old, married and has two children who attend school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish.  She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es: Maria Jesus de 36 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales empeso con esta actividad desde hace 7 años,nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque dice que si le apoyan con el credito podra comprar lo que nececita nos comenta que nececita comprar mas animales como marranos,pollos,etc ya que biene la epoca de semana mayor y es cuando se vende muchos los animales.desde ya les agradese el apoyo.
texts.en: María Jesús, 36, raises animals.  She started with this activity seven years ago.  She tells us that she’s very happy because she says that if you help her with the loans she will be able to buy what she needs.  She comments that she needs to buy more animals like pigs, chickens, etc. because Holy Week is approaching and that’s when most animals are sold.  She thanks you for your support as of now.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Julia Liliana

texts.es: Julia Liliana, de 48 años de edad es viuda y tiene 4 hijos tres de ellos son casados y las mas pequeñas vive con ella,doña julia desde muy pequeña a trabajado en negocios y hace 25 años inicio su negocio propio tiene  un taller de costuras y reposteria y hace poco tiempo empeso a vender waipe,ella esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar(materia prima) telas hilo,y waipe,agradese a kiva el apoyo que le han brindado ya que su negocio a prosperado.
texts.en: Julia Liliana, 48, is a widow and has four children; three of them are married and the youngest lives with her.  Julia has worked in businesses since she was very little and 25 years ago started her own business.  She has a sewing shop and a pastry shop and a short time ago started selling ‘waipe’ [cleaning rags].  She is asking for the loan to buy raw materials: fabric, thread and rags.  She thanks Kiva for the support it has provided since her business has been prospering.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Juan Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos. El se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura y lo aprendió de sus padres. Es una persona honesta, responsable, con valores y principios posee buena reputación en la comunidad, es una familia unida, es jornalero y manifiesta que desea brindarle una mejor vida a su familia. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 25 pliegos de lámina que cuestan $325 dólares, clavos y pago de mano de obra, para construir una nueva cocina en su casa. Así él construirá una cocina más segura para su familia, por la época de lluvia y una casa más digna, ya que su sueño es construir una casa de bloque y brindarles a sus hijos el estudio.
texts.en:
Juan is 33 years old, married and has four children. He has been a farmer all his life and learned the job from his parents. He is an honest and responsible person with  values and principles and he has a good reputation in his community. His is a united family. He is a day laborer and states that he wants to give his family a better life.

He is applying for a loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy 26 sheets of metal, nails and to pay workers to build a new kitchen in his house.  Thus he will build a kitchen for his family that is safer during the rainy season and provide a more respectable home since his dream is to build a house out of concrete blocks as well as to provide an education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase 25 metal sheets that cost $325 and nails and to pay workers to build a new kitchen in his house.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos. Ella se ha dedicado toda su vida a realizar oficios domésticos, es una persona con valores, principios, responsable, posee buena reputación en la comunidad, es una familia unida y tienen el proyecto de mejorar su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 50 bolsas de cemento que cuestan $375 dólares, 300 bloques que cuestan $135 dólares, hierro y pago de mano de obra para construir una fosa séptica. Ella manifiesta que solo necesita una parte del dinero, ya que la otra la tiene de unos ahorros. Pascuala vive a unos 4 kilómetros de la zona urbana de la ciudad. Así ella dispondrá de los materiales para construir la fosa séptica y mejorar su casa, para tener una mejor salud en su familia.

La señora Pascuala, desea continuar trabajando con la Fundación Campo, comprar una vaca, cerdos, para trabajar en la agricultura y brindarle el estudio a su familia para mejorar la calidad de vida de ellos.
texts.en:
Pascuala, 50, is a single mother with 2 children.  She has devoted her whole life to caring for her household.  She is a responsible person with values and principles, and she has a good reputation in the community.  Her family is very united, and they plan to do some improvements to their house.

She is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy 50 sacks of cement that cost $375 dollars, 300 cement blocks that cost $135 dollars, steel and labor to build a septic tank.  She says that she only needs to borrow part of the money, because she will fund the rest of the project from her savings.  Pascuala lives 4 kilometers from the urban part of the city.  She will use these materials to build a septic tank and improve her house, so her family can have healthier living conditions.

Pascuala wants to continue working with the Fundación Campo so that she can buy a cow and pigs and work in agriculture.  This way, she can provide her children with an education and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cement, cement blocks, steel and labor to build a septic tank

loans.name: Libardo Antonio

texts.es:
Sin grandes recursos económicos, y con grandes adversidades que se le presentaron en el camino, Libardo ha tenido la fortaleza para montar su propio negocio de venta de verduras y legumbres en la plaza de mercado de su municipio, con el cual ha tenido la oportunidad de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 9 hijos. Libardo anteriormente vivía junto con su esposa y sus hijos en un municipio del cual fue desplazado por la violencia, y por lo cual se vio en la obligación de dejar todas sus pertenencias a un lado e iniciar su vida desde cero trabajando fuertemente. De allí, se mudó para el municipio de Rionegro y desde el cual pudo montar su negocio y así generar los ingresos para su hogar. Libardo, gracias a la buena atención que ofrece en su negocio, ha tenido grandes pedidos de sus clientes, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de verduras y legumbres para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Libardo espera que de esta manera su negocio se acredite cada vez más y pueda captar un mayor número de clientes. Además, Libardo espera que con mayores ingresos su familia tenga la oportunidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida. Libardo sueña con tener un gran negocio bien ubicado y bien acreditado en la plaza de mercado y desde el cual pueda generar empleo para los más necesitados y una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en: Without many financial resources and facing great adversity that presented itself along the way, Libardo has had the strength to set up his own business selling vegetables in the marketplace in his town.  His business has provided the opportunity to generate the necessary income to support his home where he lives with his wife and their 9 children. Libardo previously lived with his wife and their children in another town and were displaced by violence.  They were forced to leave all of their belongings behind and start over from zero, working very hard.  From there, they moved to the town of Rionegro and were able to set up a business to generate income for their home.  Libardo, has received large orders from his customers, thanks to the good customer service he provides.  He is therefore requesting a loan that will enable him to buy vegetables to stock his business and meet his customers' needs. Libardo hopes that his business continues to gain credibility and he can attract more customers.  Libardo also hopes that with more income his family will be able to have a better quality of life.  Libardo dreams of having a large business that is well located and well respected in the marketplace, so that he can generate employment for people who most need it and provide financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to stock his business and meet his customers' needs.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda owns and manages a general store in her village, while her husband manages their rice farming business. They endure the hardships and difficulties they encounter in life because they want to educate their three children and give them a bright future. She and her husband have planned to improve their sources of income so that they can satisfy their needs and support the education of their children.

To work out their plan, Nelda is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, oils, sugar, and soaps to sell in her store. Through this loan, she believes that she will make improvements in her business and hopes that she will be successful in carrying them out.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, oils, sugar, and soaps to sell in her store.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Yei. She has a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 26 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. 

Margret heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Madoudiarrabougou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de galettes, de poissons et de savons.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du mil, des poissons frais et du savon.                                                                          
M’PENIN, deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debouts, compte acheter 100 kg de poissons frais des poisson auprès des revendeur de Fana et de Dioïla pour ensuite les revendre au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour faire face aux besoins personnels et de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The women of the Tièssiri group are all married.  They are, on average, 32 years old, have three children each, and live in extended traditional families in the village of Madoudiarrabougou, in the Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative district of Mali).  They know each other because they are relatives, neighbors or friends.  They sell galettes (flat cakes), fish and soap.

These women are on to their third solidarity loan, which they will use to buy millet, fresh fish and soap.

In the photo, M'PENIN, is the second woman from the right in the standing row.  She is planning to buy 100 kilos of fresh fish from resellers in Fana and Dioïla.  She will then resell these fish in her village, for cash or on credit, to customers of both genders.  She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 20,000 CFA francs which will be used to meet her personal needs as well as those of her children.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 40-year-old mother who is engaged in direct selling of AVON, NATASHA, and MSE products in her village to generate income. She has three school-age children. Despite financial difficulty, she wants to continue sending her children to school because she wants them to earn degrees and become professionals someday. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Myrna aims to improve her business to increase her income. She wants to ask for additional capital of PHP 32,000 to buy lotions, body sprays, underwear, and roll-on to sell in her village. She believes that through her patience and sacrifices, she will improve the business and make it a viable and profitable source of income.

loans.use: to buy lotions, body sprays, underwear, and roll-on to sell in her village.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 30 years old. She lives in Khndzoresk village in the south of Armenia with her family: her husband and three little children. The main income for the family comes from agriculture. Marine's farm includes ten cows. Marine sells meat and milk from the farm in Kapan city regional center. 

After the long lasting winter season, which has been very cold, Marine has challenges with feeding the cattle. She has applied for this loan to purchase necessary forage for the cows. This will help Marine to continue successful breeding of the cows and have a stable income from meat and milk sales.

loans.use: to pay for forage.

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Хикматулло добрый и трудолюбивый семьянин. Более 17 лет Хикматулло занимается купле- продажей сладостей на базаре. У него широкий ассортимент конфет и печеньев. Вначале у него был небольшой товарооборот,  и он постепенно расширил бизнес. Хикматулло запрашивает займ для покупки конфет, печеньев и вафель. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Hikmatullo is a kind and hardworking family man. Hikmatullo has been buying and selling sweets on the market for more than seventeen years. He has a wide range of candy and cookies. In the beginning he had a small merchandise turnover, but gradually he has expanded his business. Hikmatullo is asking for a loan to buy candy, cookies and waffles. He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
To earn a living, Amelia and her husband help each other in managing their farm lots by planting rice and onions for sale. They have been farmers for more than 18 years, usually earning a profit of P25,000 each cropping. They want to increase their yields and income to pay for the necessities of life and support the education of their two children.

Amelia is now requesting a loan of P31,000 to buy onions, fertilizers and pesticides to expand their onion production. She and her husband believe that they will be able to increase their yields and income through their patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy onions, fertilizers and pesticides needed in onion production.

location.town: Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty products and upgrade her business premises.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernán, de 67 años es un hombre vital. Vive en compañía de su esposo a la que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo de Ocoro – Colcabamba. Cuando se unió a su pareja, dedicó su tiempo y fuerza en la agricultura, la siembra de diversos productos como habas, alverja y demás tubérculos eran su especialidad. Se siente feliz por ello, pues todo lo que logró fue gracias a sus cultivos. Pero con el tiempo, sus fuerzas no eran las mismas, fue así que decidió incursionar en el negocio de compra de granos verdes, donde todos los fines de semana, mira sus ganancias en la venta que realiza en la feria de Pampas, ya que cuenta que durante la semana se encarga de recolectar de los proveedores. Cuenta que a pesar de la inconveniencia que tienen, se siente deseoso de seguir trabajando muy duro. Asta el día en que las fuerzas lo abandonen. “Tolo lo que realizó es para ver a mi mujer tranquila”, concluye. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Virgen candelaria” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria. Hernán de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de granos para su negocio.
texts.en: Hernán, 68 years old, is a man full of vitality. He lives in the company of his wife to whom he cares for in his own house located in the anex of Ocoro – Colcabamba. When they got married, he dedicated his time to the force of agriculture, the seed of diverse products like lima beans, peas, and also root crops were his speciality. He is happy for this, as all that he achieved was thanks to his crops. But with time, his strength wasn't the same, and so it was decided to enter the business of purchasing green beans, where every weekend, he watches his earnings in the sales that he makes at the Pampas market. Since during the week, he is responsible for collecting from the suppliers. He says that in spite of the inconveniences they have, he feels eager to continue working very hard. Until one day his strength abandonded him. "All I did was to see my wife peaceful" he concluded. He belongs to the group "Virgen candelaria and this is his third loan with MFP, where he felt developed and happy. He hope to obtain the loan in order to continue with his objectives. Also, he promises to pay his payments punctually, as he is a responsible and caring person. From receiving your support, Hernán will invest the requested funds into the purchase of grains for his business.

loans.use: to buy grain to supply his business.

loans.name: Selly Chemutai

texts.en: Selly has requested her third loan from KADET LTD for KES. 41,800  to pay her child's university tuition.  Her dairy farm is generating income with which she will repay the loan. Selly's dream is to live a happy life and improve her dairy farm.

loans.use: to pay her child's university tuition.

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es: Ayde, de 32 años es una mujer independiente. Vive en compañía de Edwin, su esposo con quien vive en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Ocoro – Colcabamba. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer tímida, pero alegre. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en la comercialización de granos verdes, los cuales le otorgan un ingreso semanal y constante. Antes gustaba de la siembra, comenta que no deja de hacerlo pero solo para su propio consumo, ya que existen varios que se dedican a esa actividad. Ella no quiere ser una más, por eso emprendió este negocio nuevo y de ganancias estables. Ahora desea comprar un lugar estable en una zona de comercio para poder negociar sus menestras a buen precio y proyectarse a ser una empresaria mayorista. “Esa es mi meta, espero conseguirlo con el apoyo de mi esposo y familia, sobre todo porque mis hijos son pequeños y necesitarán de nosotros más adelante”, afirma. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Virgen candelaria” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria. Ayde re recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de granos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ayde, 32, is an independent woman who lives with her husband, Edwin in their own house, on the outskirts of Ocoro-Colcambamba.  She is characterized as being a shy woman, but cheerful.  Her main business is selling fresh legumes which gives her a weekly and regular income.  In the past she liked to farm, she says, and she still does, but only for personal consumption.  There are others who farm and she doesn’t want to be one more.  


 That is why she started her new business and it is giving her regular earnings.  Now she wants to buy a fixed place in a commercial zone to be able to sell her legumes at a good price and she plans to be a wholesale entrepreneur in the future.  “This is my goal, and I hope to succeed with help from my husband and family. My goal is especially for my children who are young, and will need our support later on".  She belongs to the communal bank “Virgen candelaria” and this is her third loan with MFP.  She feels supported and happy now that she  is expecting a loan to help with her objectives.  She promises to make her payments punctually since she is a responsible and serious person.  Ayde will use the requested money to buy legumes for her business.

loans.use: to buy grain to stock her business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 61 years old. She lives in Agarak town with her son. Julieta works at a local factory as an electrician. Because her salary was not enough to cover the family's daily costs, Julieta started running a farm. About 10 years ago she started running an orchard. After 6 years Julieta also got involved in cattle breeding. Now Julieta plans to expand her farm by purchasing two cows. With the help from this loan, she will also purchase necessary forage for the cattle.

This loan will help Julieta to increase the income from agriculture and live with a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for cows and forage.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, a 39-year-old married father of two, has been repairing autos to earn a living for 14 years, and employs two people. His business environment is busy because he is visited regularly by his customers. Since joining Faulu Kenya, John has been able to improve his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He is now requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 37 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Virgilio, su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos cuidan de sus 5 hijos a los que crían en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo de Viñas. Su principal desea es dedicarse a la ganadería con la crianza de animales en especial de vacas, de las que quiere aprovechar la leche que suministra para realizar todo tipo de productos lácteos. Cuenta que posee 2 vacas, de las que muy pronto comenzaran a proporcionarle leche. Además de ello tiene cerdos. Sigue firme en este deseo y ya muy pronto piensa adquirir más animales. Mientras tanto trabaja como peón en otras chacras, cuenta que lo realiza de 2 a 3 veces por semana, le gusta mucho cultivar los sembríos y quitar la maleza que crece entre los surcos, eso la hace sentirse en paz, asimismo su esposo se dedica al trabajo de albañilería, por ahora solo es ayudante, pero muy pronto desea aprender más para ser albañil y no ayudante. Sabe que lo conseguirá, pues estos deseos de superación hacen que ellos se mantengan firmes y que paso a paso logren sus objetivos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria. María de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de calaminas, ventanas y puertas para poder acondicionar el establo de sus animales.
texts.en: María, 37 years old, is a happy woman. She lives with Virgilio, her husband of 20 years. Together they care for their 5 children whom they raise in their own house located in the annex of Viñas. her greatest desire is to earn a living raising animals, especially cows from whom she wants to use the milke that they produce to make all types of dairy products. She says that she has 2 cows, from whom she quickly began to supply milk. Addition she has pigs. She stays strong in this desire and already wants to quickly acquire more animals. Meanwhile she works as a hard laborer on other farms. She says she does it 2-3 times a week. She like very much to cultive the crops and pull weeds growing between the rows, that it makes her feel peaceful. Also her husband is a masonry, for now he is only an apprentice, but very soon he wants to learn very quickly in order to be a mason and not an apprentice. He knows that he will get it, so these desire of improvement make them stay firm and so that step by step they achieve their objectives. Additionally she promises to pay her payments punctually, as she is a caring and responsible person. María, from receiving your support, will invest the funds requested in the purchase of roofing, windows and doors, where she will be able to build a stable for her animals.

loans.use: to buy roofing, windows and doors to build a stable.

loans.name: Alejandro De Jesus

texts.es:
Debido a la poca calidad de vida que podía gozar mientras desempeñaba su trabajo ordeñando vacas o cargando bultos en su municipio, Alejandro tenía el sueño de montar su propio negocio con el cual pudiera mejorar las condiciones de su trabajo y con el cual tuviese una mejor remuneración por el mismo. Fue así como montó su tienda general en la cual ofrece toda clase de productos de la canasta familiar y gracias al cual genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Alejandro ofrece una buena atención a sus clientes y esta característica es la que le ha permitido captar un gran número de clientes en su negocio y poder tener muy buenos niveles de ventas. Gracias a que el negocio ha ido creciendo, Alejandro busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para surtir su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Alejandro espera que de esta manera pueda surtir su negocio y sus clientes encuentren más atractivo el mismo, de modo que pueda aumentar la cantidad de clientes y por ende sus ingresos. Además, Alejandro espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para su progreso.
texts.en:
Due to the poor quality of life that he had while he worked milking cows or carrying bags in his municipality, Alejandro had the dream of setting up his own business.  With that business he would be able to improve his working conditions, and he would get better income for himself.

That was how he established his general store, where he sells all types of basic needs products.  Thanks to the store he generates the income he needs to support his household.  Alejandro provides his customers with good service.  This is the characteristic that has allowed him to gain a large number of customers in his business.  He has also been able to have good levels of sales, and thankfully, his business has been growing.

Alejandro seeks a loan to buy basic needs products to stock his business and offer a greater variety of products to his customers.  Alejandro hopes that he will be able to stock his business, and that his customers will find it more enticing.  This way he will be able to increase the number of customers he has and, therefore, increase his income.

Also, Alejandro hopes that with greater income his family will be able to enjoy a better quality of life and have greater financial opportunities to advance.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products to stock his business and offer a greater variety of products to his customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 34 years old and married with two children. She does gardening and landscaping to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and has employed 28 people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business and hopes to expand it in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy gardening tools and a lawnmower.

loans.use: To buy gardening tools and a lawnmower.

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гулзат  35 лет, замужем, воспитывает трех детей - школьников.    В 2008 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Гулзат начала свой бизнес в животноводстве,  использовав на эту цель стартовую сумму в 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день,  в хозяйстве Гулзат имеется  1 лошадь, 5 овец, 5 коз и 2 коровы, приносящие около 10,000 сом в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Желание накопить средства для обучение детей подтолкнуло Гулзат на расширение бизнеса за счет открытия продуктового ларька. В целях увеличения оборотных средств, Гулзат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS), что позволит ей расширить ассортимент продуктов и обрести новых клиентов.  Доходы Гульзат планирует частично вложить в закуп стройматериалов для постройки кошары, и часть – в развитие бизнеса в торговле.
texts.en: Gulzat is 35 years old, married and is raising three school age children. While looking for a source of income for her family Gulzat started her business in 2008 doing animal husbandry with a starting capital of 20,000 som (KGS). Today Gulzat's business has one horse, five sheep, five goats and two cows bringing around 10,000 KGS monthly from the sale of milk and dairy products. The desire to save some money for her children's education pushed Gulzat to expand her business and open a food stall. With the goal to increase her working capital Gulzat has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 75,000 KGS which will let her expand the variety of products and acquire new customers. Gulzat plans to partially invest the income from the loan to buy building materials to build a shed for the livestock and partially into the growth of her retail business.

loans.use: to expand the variety of products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his shop and a second hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Celmira

texts.es:
Celmira, de 54 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, además de muy jovial y sociable. Está casada con Placido quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus 4 hijos pero solo vive en compañía de su hijo Jonathan  de 19 años y Grecia de 12 años de edad  a los que quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Celmira es el alquiler de juegos de videos, para lo cual instaló en su casa un pequeño local, donde solo se permite el ingreso de mayores de edad, se inicio hace más de 1 año empezando con dos videojuegos, logrando hacerlo crecer,  contando con la ayuda de sus hijos en la atención al publico. También vende productos de belleza que compra por catálogo y los vende entre sus familiares y amistades a quien atiende de manera amable logrando hacerse conocida, lleva más de 5 años en ésta actividad.
Considera a sus negocios bastantes rentables por las buenas ganancias que le deja, con el cual puedo apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar.
Le gusta su actividad por el buen ambiente que  tiene, y el atender a sus clientes muy amablemente. Por otro lado, no le gusta es el desorden que por momentos se ocasiona cuando se llena su local. Pero con los ingresos económicos  le permiten solventar los gastos de su hogar. Por otro lado tiene planes de ampliar su negocio e instalar mas maquinas de video y en un futuro una bodega de venta de abarrotes en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de 2 maquinas de video juegos valorizadas en total a 2000 nuevos soles, así como en gastos de su instalación, de esa manera poder atender la demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
Celmira is 54 and is an enterprising and hard-working woman.  She is also very cheerful and sociable.  She is married to Placido, who makes a living through transportation.  He is the father of their 4 children, but only their son Jonathan, who is 19, and their daughter Grecia, who is 12, still live with them.  Celmira loves them very much.  They live comfortably in their own home.  Celmira makes a living renting video games.  She has a small location in her house for her business, and only adults can enter.  She started her business more than a year ago with 2 video games, and she has made it grow.  Her children help her attend to the customers.  She also sells beauty products that she buys from a catalog and sells them among family members and friends.  She attends to them in a friendly manner, which makes her business known.  She has sold beauty products for more than 5 years.  She considers her businesses to be rather profitable, and she can help her husband with their home's expenses.  She likes her job because of the good atmosphere it has, and she likes helping her customers in a friendly way.  On the other hand, she doesn't like the disorder that happens at times when her business is crowded.  But with her income, she can pay for her home's expenses.  She has plans to expand her business and install more video game machines.  In the future, she wants to have a small grocery store in her home.  This will be her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  Through it, she hopes to make her plans concrete.  She promises to make her payments on time like she has with her previous loans.

With the requested amount of 3,000 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of 2 video game machines valued at 2,000 PEN total, and for the costs of their installation.  In this way, she can address the demand she has.

loans.use: to buy two video game machines and to pay for their installation.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda, de 64 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, además de ser amable y de un trato cordial.  Es conviviente con Félix quien se dedica a la agricultura y es padre de sus 6 hijos. Vive en compañía de su pareja y 2 de sus hijos Freddy de 37 años  y Carlos de 18 años de edad ya que lo demás son independientes, a los que quiere mucho, habita  en una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Florinda es la venta de plátanos para lo cual a acondicionado una mesa en el frontis de su casa y atiende a sus clientes, siendo en su mayoría sus propios vecinos a lo que atiende  de manera cordial y amena llegando a ganarse sus amistad. Lleva dedicándose a ésta actividad hace más de 3  años, con un préstamo de MFP y contando con la ayuda de sus hijos en la compra del producto y la atención de los clientes, en sus ratos libres. Considera su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su actividad que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder apoyar a su pareja en los gastos de su hogar, pues tuvo que dejar su empelo de cuidar niños por su avanzada edad. Espera poder mantener su negocio y seguir contando con su sustento diario, ya que por su edad no podrá conseguir empleo. Este sería el préstamo numero 7  con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad brindada, que le ha valido de mucho cuando más lo necesitaba, desea seguir contando con éste apoyo, y seguirá siendo puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con e monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de plátanos buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, aprovechando que éste producto está de escasez y los precios están al alza, de esa manera tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Florinda, 64, is a hardworking and enterprising woman, in addition to being kind and of a friendly manner.  She lives with Félix, who works in agriculture and is the father of her six children.  She lives with her partner and two of their children, Freddy, 37, and Carlos, 18, because the others are on their own.  She loves them very much.  She lives in a house that is her own property.

The work Florinda does is selling bananas, for which she has equipped a table in the front part of her house and waits on her customers.  The majority of them are her own neighbors, whom she serves cordially and pleasantly, to gain their friendship.  She has been working in this job for more than three years, with a loan from MFP and having the help of her children in buying the product and waiting on the customers in their free time.  She considers her business worthwhile for the profits it gives her.

She likes her job, which allows her to have an income with which to be able to help her partner with the household expenses, because she had to leave her job taking care of children because of her advanced age.  She hopes to be able to support her business and continue having her daily means of support, because she will not be able to find a job because of her age.

This will be her seventh loan with the MFP institution.  She is contented and grateful for the opportunity given, which has meant a lot to her when she most needed it.  She wants to continue having this support and she will continue being punctual with her payments.

With the requested total of 1200 nuevos soles (PEN), she will invest in buying bananas, looking for low prices for her bulk purchases, taking advantage of the fact that this product is scarce and the prices are on the rise.  In this way she will have greater profits.

loans.use: to buy more bananas.

loans.name: Fortin

texts.es:
Fortin, de 36 años de edad, es un hombre alegre y activo, además de ser empeñoso y trabajador. Es conviviente con Lupe quien se dedica al comercio y es madre de sus 2 hijos Ibet de 10 y Junis de 6 años de edad a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos  viven con sus dos hijos en una casa alquilada. El trabajo que realiza Fortin es la compra y venta de vehículos y artefactos de segundo uso de diversos modelos, los cuales trae a pedido, los compra de sus vecinos y amistades, contando con muchos clientes. Los pone en exhibición en su casa alquilada donde acondiciono un espacio donde gurda sus mercadería. Esta actividad la realiza de modo personal, por lo que tiene más de 4 años en éste negocio. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, ya que lo vio más rentable.
Le gusta de ésta actividad que le genera un ingreso económico con el cual poder tener un sustento para la economía de su hogar, se siente contento  ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones y le ha sacado de muchos apuros económicos, tiene las ganas de seguir trabajando y poder ampliar su negocio, y con las ganancias comprarse su propia casa y abrir su local sin tener que pagar por alquiler. Este sería el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, se siente muy contenta con la oportunidad brindada de poder contar con un préstamo, para lo cual se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos y así poder tener un buen record crediticio.
Con el dinero solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de artefactos de segundo uso, en mayor cantidad y menor precio,  así tener mayores ganancias, que le servirá para pagar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Fortin is 36 and is a happy and active man.  He is also hard-working.  He is in a common-law marriage with Lupe, who works in trade and is the mother of their 2 children:  Ibet, who is 10, and Junis, who is 6.  Fortin loves them very much.  They live with their 2 children in a rented home.  Fortin buys and sells vehicles and various second-hand items, for which he takes orders.  He buys them from his friends and neighbors, and he has a lot of customers.  He displays them in his rented house where he has a space set up to keep his merchandise.  He personally runs his business, and he has had it for more than 4 years. He considers it to be rather profitable.

He likes his job because it generates good income for him with which he can support his family.  He feels happy because it has brought him a lot of satisfaction and has kept him from having many economic predicaments.  He wants to keep working and expand his business and buy his own home with the profits.  He wants to open a location without having to pay rent for it.  This will be his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  He feels very happy to have the opportunity to have a loan.  He promises to make his payments on time so he can have a good credit record.

With the requested money of 1,200 PEN, he will invest all of it in the purchase of second-hand items in a larger quantity and lower price so he can have better profits, which will let him make his payments.

loans.use: to buy second-hand items.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 29-year-old lady and mother of two children.  She is married to Bernard, who is a government officer.

Carolyne operates a retail shop and has been doing this for the last five years. The shop earns her a monthly income of KES 5,900.  She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stocks to sell like cooking fat, sugar and bread. Her profits will be used to repay the loan.  Her dream is to grow her business through KADET loans.

loans.use: buy cooking fat, sugar and bread

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Amneh is a 46-year-old woman and a mother with three sons and three daughters.  Her husband is a worker who earns a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs. 

Amneh is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the expenses of expanding and improving her house's condition, such as: adding new rooms to the house, painting and installing tiles and windows and doors.   As her family members are getting bigger and need to feel more comfortable at home, this will offer to the family better living conditions.

loans.use: expand and improve her house

loans.name: Rophus

texts.en:
Rophus is a 67-year-old business man who sells coconut in Kilifi.  He is a married and is a father of four children.  He has been doing this business for the last six years with great success. 

This is Rophus’ fourth loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more coconut to sell to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and educate his children.  He hopes to have an expanded, well-known business.

loans.use: buy coconut

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en: Reuben, a 38-year-old married father of two, has been a successful shop owner in Mombasa for the past nine years, selling spare parts for bicycles. Now requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, he plans to purchase more bicycle pedals, tyres and motorcycle spare parts, and will use the anticipated profits to open another shop. Reuben hopes to continue to excel in his business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more bicycle pedals, bicycle tyres and motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Thhat's Group

texts.en:
As a 38-year-old mother, Thhat has to be responsible for four children who are still in school. She and her husband make their living from farming rice and from a plantation. They have been in these businesses for 12 years and can earn about US$4 per day. 

Thhat has been with VisionFund for several years and successfully repaid back her previous loans with VisionFund. The loans have enabled her to buy additional plot of land for her plantation for her current business expansion. This is her fifth loan with VisionFund.

Thhat is leading a group loan of  two other members to request a new loan. She is applying for a new loan of KHR 1,200,000 while her group members are requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the group leader, Thhat will use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to lease a water pump for her farmland and plantation so that she will gain more crop yield. She hopes that she can keep her children in school until the upper level.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and lease a water pump

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 20 years old, married, and has no children.

Roda heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: buy beans and rice

loans.name: Belindah

texts.en:
Belindah is 34 years old and is a mother of three children.  She is married to Rodgers, who is a teacher by profession. They live in Vihiga county.

Belindah operates a retail shop, a business she has been doing for the last four years, and makes a monthly income of KES 6,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stocks of  sugar, soap detergent and cooking fat. Her profits will be used to increase her savings with KADET LTD.   Her dream is to grow her retail shop.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Rozata

texts.en:
Rozata lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children -- all of them are still in school.

Rozata heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  Rozata has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy beans and rice

loans.name: Fanisi

texts.en:
Fanisi is a 42-year-old mother of four children.  She is married to Alex, who is a farmer.  They come from Vihiga county in West Kenya.

Fanisi sells green vegetables like kales, a business she has been doing for the last seven years.  She makes a monthly income of KES 6,400.  

Fanisi  is taking this loan from KADET  LTD to buy stocks of kales and other green vegetables to sell. She will will use her profits to educate her children.  Her dream is to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: buy green vegetables

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a businessman.  He operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 2 years and describes his business environment as competitive but promising. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Joseph has been able to improve his living standards, and he hopes to be financially stable in the future. Joseph has applied for 89,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel, de 22 años de edad, es un joven  emprendedor y dinámico, además de alegre y sociable. Es soltero sin hijos.  Vive en compañía de su tío cómodamente instalados en la casa de su propiedad, compartiendo los gastos y arreglos de la casa. El negocio que tiene Joel en la venta de golosinas y frutas de la región para eso abrió una pequeña bodega en el frontis de su casa, donde además vende bebidas gaseosas, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos.
Iniciándose hace más de 1 años con un préstamo de un familiar logrando hacerlo crecer a base  de esfuerzo atendiendo todo el día,  y realizando sus compras cada dos días, siendo sus principales clientes su vecinos y transeúntes, que ha sabido ganarse a lo largo del tiempo que lleva  funcionando su negocio y cuenta con la ayuda de su tío en ocasiones que él está fuera de casa.
Considera a su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja, su actividad le permite  tener un ingreso económico para sus gastos personales, como pagar sus estudios superiores y apoyar en los gastos del hogar, le gusta atender y socializar con los vecinos. Por lo contrario, no le gusta de su negocio, que lo ve pequeño, desea poder hacerlo crecer más, para  tener mayores ganancias, por eso tiene planes de surtir su negocio con mayor variedad de productos, también en un futuro abrir unas Cabimas de Internet. Este  será el  préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por eso será responsable con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores, y tener un buen record crediticio. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más variedad de golosinas al por mayor a menores precios, también productos de abarrotes, bebidas gaseosas, de esa manera tener un stock disponible para venta y ver crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Joel, who is 22 years old, is a young and dynamic entrepreneur, in addition to being happy and sociable. He is single and has no children. He lives comfortably in the company of his uncle in the house on his property, sharing the expenses and the household chores. Joel's business is the sale of candies and local fruits. To do this, he opened a little shop in the front of his house, where he also sells soft drinks, serving his customers, the majority of whom are his own neighbors, in a very kindly manner.

He began his business more than a year ago with a loan from a family member. He succeeded in making it grow, thanks to his effort, tending to his shop all day. He makes his purchases every two days. His principal customers are his neighbors and passers-by, whose business he has known how to win over the time that he has been running his business. He has the help of his uncle on occasions when he is away from the house.

He considers his business profitable because of the earnings that it provides him. His business allows him to have an income for his personal expenses, such as his higher-level education, and to help with the household expenses. He likes to serve his neighbors and socialize with them. On the other hand, what he doesn't like about his business is that he sees it as small. He wants to be able to make it grow more, to have greater earnings, and for this reason he has plans to stock his business with a greater variety of products. In the future he would also like to open some internet booths. This will be his second loan with MFP, and so he hopes for your assistance to continue with his objectives. He will be responsible in making his payments, as he was with his previous loan, in order to have a good credit record. With the 1500 PEN that he has applied for, he will invest in the wholesale purchase of a greater variety of candy at lower prices and also grocery products and soft drinks, so that in this way he can have available stock to sell and see his business grow.

loans.use: to buy candies, beverages, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es:
Luz Mary es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades. Luz Mary se encuentra casada y es madre de 2 hijos de 2 y 3 años de edad, quienes siempre han sido su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. Luz Mary se dedica a la actividad de la confección y ofrece el servicio de la confección a terceros, la cual aprendió de su hermana que siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos, Luz Mary ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes, quienes a su vez le han garantizado unos grandes niveles de ventas y que gracias a esto Luz Mary genera 2 puestos de trabajo y espera generar uno más. Con el ánimo de comprar una máquina para su taller en la cual pueda trabajar una nueva persona que requiere contratar, Luz Mary busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina fileteadora con la cual pueda trabajar un nuevo empleo que va a generar en su taller.

Luz Mary espera que de esta manera pueda seguir mejorando la calidad de vida no solo de su familia sino de las demás personas a las que pueda ayudar. Además, Luz Mary espera que su negocio siga creciendo como lo ha venido haciendo y con este pueda ofrecer a sus hijos y su esposo una mejor calidad e vida. Luz Mary sueña con que su taller crezca y se consolide en su sector y le permita cumplir su sueño de comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luz Mary is a person noted for being very hard-working, who always succeeds in spite of adversity. Luz Mary is married, and the mother two children, ages 2 and 3; they have always been her motivation for working hard in her business.

Luz Mary is a dressmaker and offers sub-contracted sewing services. She learned this trade from her sister who has always worked in this activity. Thanks to the good quality of her work, Luz Mary has managed to attract a large number of customers, who in turn have guaranteed her a high level of sales. Thanks to this, Luz Mary has created two work positions and hopes to create one more.

Her intention is to buy a machine for her workshop so that a new person that she needs to hire can work. Luz Mary is seeking a loan that will enable her  to purchase an overlock machine for a new job that she is going to create in her workshop.

Luz Mary hopes that this way she can keep improving the quality of life, not only of her family, but also of the other people she can help. Luz Mary also hopes that her business keeps growing as it has been doing, so she can offer her children and husband a better quality of life. 

Luz Mary dreams about her workshop growing and becoming well-established in her area, enabling her to fulfill her dream of buying her own home.

loans.use: To buy an overlock machine for a new job she is going to create in her workshop.

loans.name: Samuel Anibal

texts.es:
Sin un gran capital Samuel decidió montar su negocio con el cual pudiese generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar donde convive con su único hijo. Samuel se dedica desde hace aproximadamente 4 años a su negocio de montallantas en el cual ofrece los servicios de engrasadero, lavadero, montallantas, vulcanizado de llantas y cambio de aceite, y gracias a esto ha podido captar un gran número de clientes por la buena atención que ofrece. Samuel tiene en su negocio la esperanza puesta de que este le brindará la oportunidad de superar las grandes adversidades que le ha presentado la vida, además que así podrá ofrecer a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Con el ánimo de poder hacer su trabajo más ágil, y evitar posibles consecuencias de salud por su trabajo, Samuel busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina con la cual pueda hacer la actividad del desmontaje y montaje de llantas sin tener que hacer tanto esfuerzo que es perjudicial para su salud y haciéndolo en un menor tiempo y tener mayor capacidad para atender a más clientes.

Samuel espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá atender a una gran cantidad de clientes que antes no tenía el tiempo suficiente para hacerlo. Además, con la máquina podrá tener un descanso de los grandes esfuerzos que requiere hacer en su negocio. Samuel sueña con tener un gran negocio de montallantas y quiere adicionar un local donde pueda comercializar aceites y repuestos para autos.
texts.en:
Without a large supply of capital, Samuel decided to set up his business, with which he would be able to generate the income necessary to support his household, where he lives with his only son. Samuel has worked for approximately 4 years in his automotive services business, in which he offers lubrication, washing, mounting tires, repairing tires, and oil changes, and thanks to this he has been able to win a large number of customers because of the good service that he offers. In his business, Samuel has placed the hope that this will offer him the opportunity to overcome the great adversities that life has presented him. In addition, he hopes that he will thus be able to offer his son a better quality of life. With the intention of being able to make his work go more smoothly and avoid possible health consequences because of his work, Samuel is seeking a loan that will offer him the opportunity to purchase a machine with which he can do the work of dismounting and mounting tires without having to exert so much force, which is harmful to his health, and which can do it in less time, so that he will thus have the capacity to serve more customers.

Samuel hopes that in this way his income will grow considerably, since he will be able to serve a large number of customers, which he did not have enough time to do in the past. In addition, with the machine he will be able to have a rest from the great efforts that are needed in his business. Samuel dreams of having a large automotive service business and wants to add a shop where he can sell oil and spare parts for cars.

loans.use: to buy a machine with which he can dismount and mount tires without having to make so much effort, which is harmful to his health, and which will do it in less time, so that he can have greater ability to serve more customers.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin is 38 years old and lives in Maningcol, Ozamis City. She is married with two school-aged children.

Elvin has a furniture business and earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase materials for her furniture business.

Elvin has been a member of PMPC for  two months. In the future, Elvin hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her furniture business

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 62 years old and lives in Tangub City. She is married with 3 children. 
Cresencia has a general store. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of 7000.
Cresencia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Cresencia hopes to many more stores.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store

loans.name: Paulina's Group

texts.en:
Paulina is married with 5 children. She is 59 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.   
Paulina has a general store. She has had this business for 6 years. Each month she earned 4,500 from this activity. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.
Paulina has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.Although the members borrow as a group, each member has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Plaviana

texts.en:
Plaviana is 39 years old, single and lives in Barangay 2,Tangub City in the province of Misamis Occidental. She has a business of buy and sell copra and charcoal and earns approximately 12,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

Plaviana has a requested a loan amount of 50,000 for additional business capital. Her ambition is to improve her living conditions by using profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy copra and charcoal

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 30 years old and lives in Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is single.
 
Ivy has a  business of grocery store and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan amount of 5,000 for additional business capital.  Ivy has been a member of PMPC since this year.   In the future, Ivy hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of her business.

loans.use: for buy groceries goods

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 36 years old and lives in Silanga,Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children.  Angie has a shop that is an Internet cafe.  She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan to pay bills.  

Angie has been a member of PMPC since this years.  In the future, Angie hopes to improve living conditions by using the profits of her business.

loans.use: for bills payment

loans.name: Crispy

texts.en:
Crispy is 36 years old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is married and has four children. 

Crispy has a business of grocery store and earns approximately PHP 4,700 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan amount of 20,000 for additional business capital.  Crispy has been a member of PMPC since this year.   In the future,  Crispy hopes to improve her living conditions by using her profits.

loans.use: to buy groceries goods for the grocery store

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz Mery es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y querer ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Luz Mery se encuentra casada y es madre de 2 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer la mejor calidad de vida posible, además, de que son su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio todos los días. Luz Mery se dedica a la actividad de la peluquería desde hace 9 años, la cual aprendió gracias a que tomó cursos en academias de belleza. Hace aproximadamente 6 años, cuando aún era empleada en un salón de belleza, decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio con el que pudiese tener mayor libertad y mejores ingresos en su hogar. Fue así como Luz Mery comenzó con el montaje de su propia sala de belleza donde ofrece un muy buen servicio y gracias a esto ha podido captar un gran número de clientes. Debido a adversidades con las que se ha tenido que encontrar, a Luz Mery se le ha hecho muy difícil sacar su negocio adelante, sin embargo, su espíritu de lucha y ganas de salir adelante le han permitido superar las dificultades y continuar progresando con su negocio. Luz Mery busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de accesorios como sillas, lava-cabezas, cepillos, entre otros, con los cuales pueda dotar con mejor herramientas su salón de belleza.

Luz Mery espera que de esta manera sus ingresos mensuales no se vean afectados para conseguir estos accesorios, además, de que posteriormente sus ingresos aumentarán considerablemente, pues podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor atención y un mejor servicio. Luz Mery sueña con que su negocio le brinde mejores oportunidades económicas y le permita ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos y su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Mery is a person who has always been noted for being very hard-working, and for wanting to offer her family a better quality of life. Luz Mery is married and the mother of two children, to whom she has always wanted to provide the best quality of life possible; they are her motivation for working hard in her business every day.

Luz Mery has been a hairdresser for nine years, which she learned by taking courses in beauty academies. Approximately two years ago, when she was still employed in a beauty salon, she decided to go independent and set up her own business, so she could have greater freedom and better household income. 

This was how Luz Mery began setting up her own beauty salon, where she offers a very good service. Thanks to this she has been able to attract a large number of customers. Due to the adversity she has had to face, it has been very difficult for Luz Mery to keep her business going. However, her fighting spirit and desire to succeed have allowed her to overcome the difficulties and continue moving forward with her business.  

Luz Mery is seeking a loan that will enable her to purchase accessories such as chairs, wash units, brushes and other items, to better equip her beauty salon.

Luz Mery hopes that this way her monthly income will not be impacted in order to get these accessories. She also hopes that her income will subsequently increase considerably, as she will be able to offer her customers better service. Luz Mery dreams about her business providing her with economic opportunities and allowing her to offer her two children and her husband a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy accessories such as chairs, wash units, brushes and other items, to better equip her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and inputs needed to make her crafts.

loans.name: Ercilia

texts.es:
Ercilia de 40 años de edad casado con Darío de 44 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 5 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Llochegua. Ercilia se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en su local que está ubicado en su distrito. Cuenta que empezó en  esta actividad gracias a la iniciativa que ella misma tenía, desde que era aún pequeña, pues soñaba con tener su propio negocio, hasta una mañana vieron que un vecino suyo trabajaba expendiendo prendas de vestir quien era el único por esa época y vendía a un precio muy por no tener competencia. Entonces fue así que Ercilia, al tener un capital resultado de la venta de las producciones agrícolas que ella tenia, logró abrir su tienda de venta de ropa, pero aun no contaba con experiencia suficiente por lo que siempre tuvo decaimientos pero supo superarlos. Actualmente tiene una tienda repleta no solamente de prendas si no que también de calzados y todo va marchando bien. Ercilia esta contenta con el negocio por que le genera una buena rentabilidad gracias a la buena acogida que tiene. Mas adelante esta pensando en continuar creciendo con su negocio si es posible abrir una sucursal en otro distrito. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Ercilia esta conforme con su banco comunal por que son transparentes con los trabajos que realizan.
Con los 4,000 nuevos soles realizara la compra de mas prendas.
texts.en:
Ercilia, 40, is married to Dario, 44, and together they have five children. They live in their own home in the district of Llochegua. Ercilia sells clothing in her store in her district. She says that she got started thanks to her own initiative - from a very young age she dreamed of having her own business, and one morning she saw that a neighbor was selling clothing. The neighbor was the only one at that time, and didn't sell much because they weren't competent. So Ercilia, with capital from selling produce from her farm, was able to open up her clothing store. She didn't yet have much experience so there were setbacks, but she was able to overcome them. Now she has store stocked not only with clothing but also shoes, and it's going very well. Ercilia is happy with her business because it makes a good profit thanks to her good reception. Later she would like to continue growing the business, maybe by opening a branch in another district. 

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually. Ercilia is happy with her village bank because they are transparent in their work. With the 4,000 nuevos soles she will buy more clothing.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia, de 55 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Jorge, su esposo. Ambos tienen 7 hijos todos ellos menores, juntos cuidan de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en el barrio La Esperanza. La sonrisa que posee es muestra de su vitalidad. Pues a pesar de su edad ella, desea seguir sembrando, “estar en el campo me gusta mucho”, afirma. Es una mujer muy capaz, todas las mañanas desde muy tempranas horas se dedica al cuidado de sus sembríos, cuenta con cultivos de papa, maíz y cebada, los cuales son su principal sustento e ingreso económico. Cuenta que en cada cosecha comercializa sus alimentos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Huancayo, donde es conocida pues tiene muchos años de experiencia en este tipo de cultivo. Como buena mujer del campo también tiene animales como vacas, burros y cerdos, que le ayudan cunado más lo necesita, el pequeño burro que tiene, lo utiliza como animal de carga, pues el lugar donde vive es muy alejado, además de los demás animales como la vaca y los cerdos, los comercializa cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Huaribamba” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria
Lidia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y semilla de papa para su próximo sembrío.
texts.en:
Lidia, 55, is a hardworking woman. She lives with Jorge, her husband, and their 7 young children whom they care for together in their own home located in the neighborhood of La Esperanza. She possesses a smile that demonstrates her vitality. In spite of her age, she wants to keep planting "I really like to be in the fields," she says. She is a capable woman, and very early every morning she starts taking care of her plantings. She has potato, corn and barley, which are her main sustenance and source of income. She says that after every harvest she sells her crops in the wholesale market in Huancayo, where she is well known because of her many years of experience. As a good rural woman she also has animals like cows, donkeys and pigs that help her out. The small donkey is a pack animal because they live far away, and she sells the pigs and cows when she needs money. 

She belongs to the village bank "Huaribamba" and this is her 7th loan from MFP, where she feels happy and developed because she hopes to get another loan to continue working towards her goals. She promises to make punctual payments. She is an individually and collectively responsible person. 

Lidia will use the requested loan to buy natural fertilizers and potato seeds for her next planting.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers and potato seeds.

loans.name: Celfita

texts.es: Celfita, de 45 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, buena y que sacrifica todo por sus tres hijos de 12, 8 y 4 años, a quienes tiene que educar y alimentar sola pues ella es madre soltera, vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus hijos, sus padres y un hermano quien tiene también su familia viviendo ahí. El trabajo de Celfita consiste en la venta de ropa, trae ropa de la ciudad de Lima y se va al mercado más cercano de su casa para ahí empezar a ofrecer sus productos de forma ambulatoria. Lleva trabajando así ya por tres años, lo hace sola ya que al separarse de su pareja tuvo que ver la manera de poder llevar algo para la comida y educación de sus hijos, durante éste tiempo de trabajo, ha logrado comprender lo que desean los clientes y es por eso que tiene siempre un diseño o modelo que gusta y encanta a las personas a quienes les ofrece. Le gusta de su trabajo pues tiene tiempo a disposición para que ella pueda hacer algunas otras actividades, además como es un mercado muy concurrido siempre tiene venta aunque hay días buenos y algunos malos. Ella sabe que tiene que esforzarse mucho y como es perseverante siempre lleva algo para su hogar. Espera en algún momento tener su tienda de ropa en donde pueda atender mejor y con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete a pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas como en sus créditos anteriores que tuvo, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal en donde todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mas mercaderías para seguir ofreciendo y vendiendo a sus clientes quienes están pidiendo nuevos modelos y mayor variedad de tallas.
texts.en:
Celfita is 45 years old.  She is a mother in a very hardworking family, and she sacrifices everything for her three children (ages 12, 8 and 4), whom she has to educate and feed alone because she is a single mother.  She lives in her parents’ home with her children and a brother, whose family is also living there.

Celfita’s job consists of the sale of clothing.  She brings the clothing from the city of Lima and she goes to the market that is the closest to her house to offer her products as a street vendor.  She has been working like this for three years.  She does this alone, because since she separated from her spouse, she has had to find a way to provide food and education to her children.  

During this period of working, she has succeeded in learning what her customers are looking for and it is for this reason that she always has a design or model  that her customers love.  She likes this job, since she has time to participate in other activities.  Also, since it is a very busy market, she always has sales, although there are good days and some bad ones.  She knows that she has to work hard, and since she is persistent, she always brings something home to her family.  She hopes that at some point she will have her clothing store, where she can do a better job of attending to her customers and offer them more comfort.  

This will be loan number three with MFP, so she hopes that with their collaboration, she will continue toward her goals.  For her part, she is committed to paying her loan back in the punctual way she did with her previous loans.  She is very happy to belong to her communal bank, where all of the members are responsible and have solidarity.  

With the amount applied for (1000 soles), she will buy more merchandise to continue offering and selling to her customers, who are asking for new designs and a greater variety of sizes.

loans.use: to buy more garments.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Ms. Rosalinda is 47 years old and lives in Caniangan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children. Ms. Rosalinda has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 6,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Ms. Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Ms. Rosalinda hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profit from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is married with six children. Marivic is 40 yrs old and lives in Paglaum, Dumalinao, Zds.

Marivic sells different foods at her carenderia to earn a living and has this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase more raw ingredients for her viand and restaurant.

Marivic has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Marivic hopes to expand her carenderia to another area/place.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her viand and restaurant

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
Gisela, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ansias de progresar, además es alegre y sociable, le gustan los negocios. Es conviviente con Biviano quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus 3 hijos que son: Leydi de 8, Julio de 4, Greysi de 1 año de edad. Todos instalados cómodamente en su propia casa que compró con mucho esfuerzo en compañía de su suegro. El trabajo que realiza Gisela es el alquiler de cabinas de Internet, donde tiene 5 computadoras bien instaladas y siendo muy concurrido ya que es la única por la zona, está instalado en un local acondicionado en su propia casa, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes.
Viene funcionando desde hace más de 1 año, iniciándose con 3 maquinas con un capital propio, luego por la demanda adquirió 2 computadoras, logrando hacer crecer su negocio un poco más, y el tiempo le ha valido para hacerse muy conocida. Para ésta actividad cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien le apoya en sus ratos libres,  ya que por las mañanas atiende ella. Le gusta su trabajo que le permite tener un ingreso económico regular para el sostén de la economía familiar y poder pagar los estudios de sus hijos que la llenan de orgullo, además de apoyar a su pareja con los gastos. Tiene gran demanda su negocio, y más en hora punta, ya que le falta computadoras y su local se llena de usuarios que son en su mayoría de la misma zona. Por ello desea ampliar y crecer su negocio. También tiene en ejecución la apertura de un nuevo negocio, que es una polleria que  está instalando al costado de la cabinas. Ahota está a la espera de la llegada del horno y ha solo 2 semanas de su inauguración, así se generará más ingresos. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida al saber que seguirá contando con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio, por tanto se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores.
Con el préstamo solicitado de 3500 nuevos soles, comprara teclados de computadoras, mouses, cables de Internet y demás accesorios para las computadoras, pues nos comenta que por el uso continuo los actuales ya están deteriorando. También invertirá, el saldo, en la compra de mesas, sillas y utensilios para el nuevo negocio de polleria.
texts.en:
Gisela, 27 years old, is a woman who is very anxious to get ahead.  She is happy and sociable and she enjoys business.
